Q ' L /L • U No. ibxo-S of 1953 . ^ The Hon’ble the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf presents his com pliments to me political A^ont, Kuwait, and has the honour to transmit to him a copy of the undermentioned docu ment British Consulate-General, BUSHIRE. Dated...oer 1955.V 4th November, 1933. No. 667. Monsieur le Mlnietre, with reference to his Highness Mirza Manomeu Ali Khan Feroughi’s note No. 16762 of Tir 26th (July 16th, 1933), I have the honour to inform Your Excellency, under instructions from His Majesty's Principal secretary of State for Foreign Affairs, that as the relations between Kowelt and Persia have not yet been regularised it is not possible for His Majesty's Government in the United Kingdom to afford any assistance in the matter of the extradition from Kowelt of Seyed Abdul- Aziz Behbehanl. 2. The documents enclosed in the note-verbale of Your Excellency's department No. 24166 of Shahrivar 28th, 1312, (September 19th, 1933), relating to the request for extradition are returned herewith. X avail myself of this opport unity to renew to Your Excellency the assurance of my highest consideration. (Signed) V.A.L. Mallet.

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: ‘File 7/2 II Service of Summonses, Documents, etc, in Kuwait Vol. 2’

physicalDescription.extent: The file is arranged in chronological order from the front to the back of the file, the exceptions being enclosures which are often of an earlier date than their covering letters.

Foliation: the main foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 21; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. An additional foliation sequence is also present in parallel between ff 3-19; these numbers are also written in pencil, but are not circled.

mods.abstract: The file is concerned with two extradition requests from the Persian Government for two individuals believed to be residing in Kuwait: Saiyid Abdul Aziz Behbahani and Abdulla Safar. The principal correspondents being the Kuwait Political Agent, the Persian Gulf Political Resident (Gordon Loch), the British Chargé d'Affaires at Tehran (Alexander Louis Mallet), and officials of the India Office and the Foreign Office.
